results.title: Day at night: I.M. Pei
results.brief_description: Interview with leading U.S. architect and designer, I.M. Pei. Covers his views on the Beaux Arts system under which he trained, his reasons for feeling that an elitist and exclusive view of architecture is no longer valid. He stresses the importance of urban housing in turning cities from places of commerce to areas offering their inhabitants a genuine richness of life

results.title: Day and night
results.creator_credit: Gaumont-British Instructional, Franz Wells and Margaret Simpson
results.brief_description: An explanation of the occurrence of day and night by means of experiments with a rotating model globe. The film deals with the rotation of the earth on its tilted axis; the sun as a source of light to the earth; the cause of day and night; the movement of the earth, with its tilted axis, round the sun, and the effect of this tilting on the length of day and night in the four seasons of the year.

results.title: Day after day
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Fernand Dansereau, Victor Jobin, Hubert Aquin and Clement Perron
results.brief_description: A look at life in a small paper-milling town in Quebec where most of the 6,500 inhabitants derive their livelihood from the one industry. Day after day the same work, the same hours, the same machines, the same product, until the entire routine of living becomes but a reflection of the dominant routines of the mill. The commentary is made up largely of fragments of thoughts which might be running through the minds of the mill workers - this is the film’s theme as it probes to the very core of company-town life. (Awards: Toronto, San Francisco, Montreal, Chicago, New York)

results.title: Dax
results.creator_credit: Mary Glasgow Audio-Visual and Antony Barrier
results.brief_description: This film tells the story of two teenage girls who arrive for a few days holiday at Dax, a thermal station in the Pyrenees Department of Lands. The narration and conversation are in simple, easy to understand French.

results.title: Dawn of the solar age
results.brief_description: SUMMARY: A survey of current methods of, and projects for, harnessing solar energy is presented in an attempt to answer the question - when oil supplies end, can the world’s industries be run by solar energy?
results.description: SUMMARY: A survey of current methods of, and projects for, harnessing solar energy is presented in an attempt to answer the question - when oil supplies end, can the world’s industries be run by solar energy?

results.title: Dawn of the dead (Uncut version) [DVD] (D)
results.creator_credit: Laurel Group Productions, Richard Rubinstein and George A. Romero
results.brief_description: In this sequel to George Romero’s “Night of the living dead”, the US is engulfed and decimated by a zombie population growing at an inexplicable and alarming rate. Two Philadelphia police S.W.A.T. officers, a helicopter pilot and his TV reporter girlfriend escape the city and take refuge in an abandoned suburban shopping mall. Their attempts to isolate themselves from the marauding army of the undead are thwarted after a band of looters leave a door open allowing the zombies free access to the mall. Romero capitalises on the shopping mall location to present an apocalyptic allegory for a rampant consumer culture driven to eat itself by its own insatiable appetite. Cast includes David Emge, Ken Foree, Scott H. Reininger. Music by Dario Argento.

results.title: Dawn of a new era: America enters the 20th century
results.creator_credit: SL Film Productions and Gerald A Schiller
results.brief_description: Looks at the United States at the turn of the century, from McKinley’s inauguration to the early days of Theodore Roosevelt’s presidency. It was the world’s largest industrial nation and employed on million children aged between ten and fifteen years earning $3.50 per week. Also shows New York at that time. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Dawn flight
results.brief_description: A dramatic story of a young glider pilot. In stunning aerial manoeuvers, tree-top chases, and pursuits through rocky canyons he is haunted by a mysterious super-pilot

results.title: Dawn
results.creator_credit: Aquataurus Film Productions, Joy Cavill and Ken Hannam
results.brief_description: Story of Australian swimmer Dawn Fraser. Dramatised biographical account of her life and times, and her acclaim as the first female athlete to win gold medals in three successive Olympic Games.
